AtomNode.trailing: -- Enforce naming conventions for index variables.

OtherNode.state_before: α : Type u_1 a : α inst✝ : SizeOf α as : Array α h : a ∈ as ⊢ sizeOf a < sizeOf as
OtherNode.tactic: cases as with | _ as => exact Nat.lt_trans (List.sizeOf_lt_of_mem h.val) (by simp +arith)

OtherNode.state_before: case mk α : Type u_1 a : α inst✝ : SizeOf α as : List α h : a ∈ { toList := as } ⊢ sizeOf a < sizeOf { toList := as }
α : Type u_1 inst✝ : SizeOf α as : Array α i : Nat h : i < as.size ⊢ sizeOf as[i] < sizeOf as
OtherNode.tactic: cases as with | _ as => simpa using Nat.lt_trans (List.sizeOf_get _ ⟨i, h⟩) (by simp +arith)

OtherNode.state_before: case mk α : Type u_1 inst✝ : SizeOf α i : Nat as : List α h : i < { toList := as }.size ⊢ sizeOf { toList := as }[i] < sizeOf { toList := as }
α : Type u_1 inst✝ : SizeOf α i : Nat as : List α h : i < { toList := as }.size ⊢ sizeOf { toList := as }.toList < 1 + sizeOf as

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: This tactic, added to the `decreasing_trivial` toolbox, proves that `sizeOf arr[i] < sizeOf arr`, which is useful for well founded recursions over a nested inductive like `inductive T | mk : Array T → T`. -/

AtomNode.val: This tactic, added to the `decreasing_trivial` toolbox, proves that `sizeOf arr[i] < sizeOf arr`, which is useful for well founded recursions over a nested inductive like `inductive T | mk : Array T → T`. -/

AtomNode.trailing: -- subsumed by simp -- | with_reducible apply sizeOf_get -- | with_reducible apply sizeOf_getElem

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: This tactic, added to the `decreasing_trivial` toolbox, proves that `sizeOf a < sizeOf arr` provided that `a ∈ arr` which is useful for well founded recursions over a nested inductive like `inductive T | mk : Array T → T`. -/

AtomNode.trailing: -- NB: This is analogue to tactic `sizeOf_list_dec`
AtomNode.val: This tactic, added to the `decreasing_trivial` toolbox, proves that `sizeOf a < sizeOf arr` provided that `a ∈ arr` which is useful for well founded recursions over a nested inductive like `inductive T | mk : Array T → T`. -/

Comment.text: -- Enforce naming conventions for index variables.

This tactic, added to the `decreasing_trivial` toolbox, proves that `sizeOf arr[i] < sizeOf arr`, which is useful for well founded recursions over a nested inductive like `inductive T | mk : Array T → T`. -/
-- subsumed by simp -- | with_reducible apply sizeOf_get -- | with_reducible apply sizeOf_getElem

This tactic, added to the `decreasing_trivial` toolbox, proves that `sizeOf a < sizeOf arr` provided that `a ∈ arr` which is useful for well founded recursions over a nested inductive like `inductive T | mk : Array T → T`. -/
-- NB: This is analogue to tactic `sizeOf_list_dec`
